citation.article-title: Litorimonas taeanensis gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from a sandy beach
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Litorimonas (Li.to.ri.moâ€²nas. L. n. litus -oris beach; L. fem. n. monas monad, unit; N.L. fem. n. Litorimonas beach bacterium).
Cells are Gram-reaction-negative, non-spore-forming, budding, straight to slightly curved rods.
Usually non-stalked and motile by means of a polar flagellum; some cells possess one polar stalk (prostheca) and are non-motile.
Neither nitrate nor nitrite is reduced.
The only isoprenoid quinone detected is ubiquinone-10 (Q-10).
The DNA G+C content of the type strain of the type species is 63.6 mol% (HPLC).
Phylogenetically, the genus Litorimonas is a member of the family Hyphomonadaceae of the class Alphaproteobacteria.
The type species is Litorimonas taeanensis.
